bio: NYC Food Stylist • Recipe Developer ✉ judykim@judykim.nyc Portfolio www.judykim.nyc

posts.description: A beautiful corner of the world with a color palette I continue to fall in love with. Talk about a constant source of inspiration.

A little rain couldn't keep us from celebrating at @amyvirginia 's record release show and party @nitecapenyc!  Lucky for us @kevmasse baked this fabulous cake for the occasion. Amy, you are a super 🌟. So happy for you darling! Congrats. 🎼🎶🎸
I had this lovely farro chicken salad, so I figure… the almond croissant doesn’t count, right?  @Niche @lapecorabianca
Baking in progress. Blueberry, blackberry w @kerrygoldusa butter & dash of aromatic @hellabitters. Who's ready for

More clean eating today. Green smoothie w a citrus twist || Orange, grapefruit, meyer lemon, kale, swiss chard, coconut water, ginger, homemade orange marmalade, @scrappysbitters grapefruit bitters, flax seeds, sun warrior & incredible homemade granola gift from my neighbor Kristen.  See more smoothie inspiration on @thefeedfeed's website www.feedfeed.info/smoothies. @vitamix

Thinking of all the French mkts & little cozy towns that I've explored as I attempt to pack my haul of travel finds. 99% sure a second bag is gonna be checked. So fun to shop the markets in each town and fill in the gaps of all my prop styling desires. One suggestion: Trust your gut, hold out on things that seem pricey and they will return to you later more unique and perhaps at a better price. Found silver in Paris and Avignon, french linen and baskets in Isle sur la Sorgue, lavender soaps and olive wood boards in Les Baux, linen dresses in Saint Remy, contemporary pottery in Arles and so much more. This antique shop was so beautifully presented in a garden setting filled with jasmine, honeysuckle and garden roses. The French do presentation so well while effortless. Continuing show & tell of my prop finds on snap chat. Currently on my way to Beaujolais/Bourgogne for wine tasting at a château, soaking up every bit of the Rhône Vally on our last day with @viking_cruises. This trip will forever be special. 👻 thejudylab
Monday inspiration. Flower market day will have to wait until tomorrow. 🌿 Just like going to the farmers market, I love seeing what local flowers are in season. Can't wait to see what's there. 🌿

*Announcements!* I'm continuing my PROP SALE this weekend both Sat 18th & Sun 19th (tabletop & housewares etc).
🍫I'll be joined by Aditi from @tachechocolate on Saturday selling her artisanal chocolates. She makes gorgeous chocolates that are made locally at her shop on the Lower East Side in NYC.
🍪I'm adding a bake sale too. Making some of these crostatas in both apple and pear versions along with some cookies (chocolate chip? Madeleines? 🤔). See my stories for updates on other vendors who will also join this weekend plus some pre-sale items.
🧀Complimentary @vermontcreamery cheeseboard happening too.
📍199 Lafayette Street Soho NYC. Nov 18-19, 11am-4pm. Preferred payments through Venmo, Paypal or cash.
🌟Excited to meet & see you this weekend.

The beginning of our first breakfast after climbing Mt Kilimanjaro in Jan. A luxurious scene after 7 days of sleeping in ⛺️on the mountain. You appreciate little things like running water, a 🚿🛁 never felt so amazing. Or ordering anything you want off a menu, especially coffee. Oh we missed ☕️. Our group is heading to Patagonia & Buenos Aires this Jan. I love having something to look forward to. Where is your next adventure?
When oysters & rosé became the new birthday cake. The birthday girl said no to sweets so we had more wine. It was a good Sunday night @grandbanksnyc.
New and old friends... The crew hiking
@jeaniusnyc and I met the legendary
The beginning of something really good...
Still thinking about those amazing cocktails last weekend when @diexico @zoemaya @zachwithan_h put on an amazing backyard shindig
No tree this year so had to make an extra special wreath. Beautiful greens from @unsqgreenmarket @grownyc.

I know summer fruit is kicking in, but I still miss blood oranges. Don't you? Steak & Cilantro salad feels incomplete without em. But I'm sure landing in PDX tomorrow is going to cure my 🍊 blues & then some.

An unforgettable first day of a recent shoot. When @dawnkperry includes you in a @real_simple pie tasting at 9am, you know it's going to be a great day ☺️. Thanks Dawn for a good day at the office. And I loved your pie ♥️ xx

Miss cooking with my Mom. It's been an amazing weekend of eating especially w @trendsontrends_ x @foodbookfair this morning. But excited to get back to cooking today. Bts snaps + cooking posole w @antonio @lifeandthyme later. 👻=thejudylab

Some people ran the NYC Marathon, I made 3 pies/galettes for work yesterday. We all have our strengths. 😂 Seriously, congrats to everyone who ran yesterday. 🏆{red anjou pear galette + vodka pie crust, crust recipe 📎 http://bit.ly/2y9CE0G, galette will be later, it's ridiculously fast- I made this at 7am}

More pie in the making... Always wanted to make a mini pie in this little cast iron pan. This will be perfect for my working meeting tomorrow. [Breaking tradition from classic pâte brisée, all butter so I'm recipe testing @PamAnderson3mc's blue ribbon pie crust with a combo of @kerrygoldusa butter & shortening. I had try it since I know @julesfood is a big fan of shortening crusts]

Such a beautiful lunch @allondanyc especially with this tuna tartare and hamachi crudu. Always fun w @kitchentablenyc and our friends at @totn_nyc @nokidhungry. Excited for the new charity projects coming up. Look out for their next Taste of the Nation event in mid April with awesome auction items including dinner at The Kitchen Table. www.nokidhungry.org

Have you ever tried to toast your pasta in brown butter? Crispy pasta edges are 🎯, yes, really. @delish

When you don't feel well, 🍚+ kimchi & you put it in your favorite bowl, @jonopandolfi. I think I eat something out of it almost everyday.

Oh I've missed my home state. Don't worry I've got an over abundance of props from antique shopping & pictures of charming Conn houses to keep us all company for a good long time. @kyleorosz @peterbernheim, Layla & I will come back and visit soon. Loved seeing you. {Saturday's antiquing adventure on stories. Ps did my part to support

My friends at @_mamannyc_ are opening @_papapoule_ a new French rotisserie chicken take out joint around the corner on Mon 2/9. I got to shoot a few behind the scenes pics during construction this weekend & can't wait to see the finished shop. The details are adorable and the chicken is divine. Best of luck Elisa, Ben & Armand. You're like the french family I never had.

Yesterday's @dutchflowerline flower run for a shoot with @taittingerusa. I can't wait to share images with you soon. Special thanks to @parisiansugar & @_seandooley_, the best team a girl could ask for. Totally whooped! First time I slept in, for as long as I can remember and getting ready to have a picnic with some friends. Hope you have a great Saturday.

Raise your hand if you hate updating your website 🙋. Having time mgmt probs btw client work & admin work for myself. Not enough hours in the day. Whoever thinks working for yourself is easy is dead wrong. So rewarding but really freakin hard work. Rant over, Sweet Potato Chips as your listening reward. Recipe ☝️.
First breakfast after climbing
Pretty weather brings pretty food. Makes me want salad and gazpacho. 🌱But seriously, isn't this weather legit? 🙌🏻

Interrupting pie posts with a Brussels Sprouts Salad w Apples, Parm & Walnuts we made for work the other day. I'm having this today but with pears, blue cheese and toasted hazelnuts. Ok, it's a totally different salad w Brussels Sprouts. Ha Ha. Meanwhile I'm finally going to make those Cheddar Biscuits today, sorry for the false alarm yesterday.

Messy food styling, my current jam. Outtakes from this weeks shoot with @muradskincare. Excited to be working with them on new healthy recipes for their site. Stay tuned. Meanwhile, I’m going to get a foot massage. Trying to be better about self-care. I hope you do something nice for yourself today. Happy Saturday 💗

Can't tell you how much fun it is to be the Pie Crust Editor for feedfeed. It's been updated recently so check it out (http://feedfeed.info/piecrust). Bonus: Posted some behind the scenes pics of the filming on my FB page/thejudylab.

Feeling better, but somehow I got convinced to try juicing an onion to kick my cold! Not gonna lie, it's DISGUSTING! This better work. At least got to use my favorite shot glass.
Did you see the forecast? It’s supposed snow again next Monday 🌨☃️❄️!!! I’d like to upgrade this situation stat🏝🍹🏖. Any other takers?

P is for Pink Peonies in Paris.

Pinch me! We’ve just arrived in NH at Andrew’s family home to celebrate the New Year and it’s a New England dream home set in a winter wonderland. Fireplaces galore & cozy AF! House tour in my stories ✨.
There will be at least 10 of us for dinner tonight for NYE and planning away the menu this morning. My fairy godmother has sent over a load of @vermontcreamery goodness... some version of a tart or pie will be def be happening.
But first we’re going to stop by @simonpearceinc to see them blow glass. Advance apologies for stories overload this wk🙊. 🎊Happy New Years Eve to you all. I’m so happy to ring in 2018 with @millercasale @janiedileo @raechild. xo JK ❄️🍾🎉☃️🥂🎊🌲
Tart recipe http://www.thejudylab.com/recipes-blog/apple-tart-with-ruffled-edges

Ramen with Black bean sauce and crispy pork belly + crispy dukbokki rice cakes @mokbar_nyc. Too bad @kitchentablenyc and I missed you @chobites.  We were nearby and came by last minute. Everything was delicious! 🍜🍜🍜 🇰🇷
Because everyone needs a wreath of Sea Salt Chocolate Chocolate Chip
Hi. It's me on that tall ass ladder 👋 Had a great time shooting at @JonoPandolfi's ceramic studio today with his awesome team.

Flaky Cheddar and Scallion Biscuits. Good for any day of the week, but for some reason they feel like a weekend thing.
🌱In other news, I made a big step in rebranding. I finally changed my website over to the new domain {www.judykim.nyc} Whoooo! The SEO is now poop, but at least it’s done. I was so terrified I held off for months, mostly fearing broken links, which I already screwed up because I changed some navigation. Oops, so many lessons while redoing a website. The rebranding continues with a never ending search for new script and serif fonts. No script yet, but I did select a web friendly serif font for headers on the website, what do you think? There are some new photos there too. This is all forcing a long overdue overhaul of the recipe section. Every time I read a recipe I want to update and simplify it plus fix all the fonts. @madeline.chen, my superstar intern and I just started the process, my apologies if there are some wonky recipes.
🌱 I rewrote this biscuit recipe because I thought you might enjoy it for Easter or on any weekend. Shout out to @cravingsinamsterdam for posting about my Spaghetti with Green Olives yesterday. Thank you Paola, your photo is a dream. I’ve cleaned up that recipe on my website too. Both spaghetti and biscuit recipes are in my profile link.

We checked out @leonsoystershop this weekend & they delivered some pretty fine fried chicken and fried clam strips in lettuce cups. We balanced it out with the iceberg stack, a deconstructed wedge salad that we absolutely loved. Oh yeah, did I mention they serve frosé and frozen G&T’s? We obviously had a terrible time. @explorecharleston
Happy Autumn! 🍁🍃🍂 Fond memories of our camping trip to Maine last Fall. Hope to be back very soon especially to see all the pretty leaves.

Just made a rookie @Instagram mistake and left the grid lines on my last Taquito post, so I deleted it. I know some of you guys saw it but were just being polite. Ha ha (btw - I don't even know how to turn that function on) Maybe I need help from Layla who is clearly more tech savy. She doesn't have thumbs but I bet this wouldn't of happened to her. 📷 @scottkolb

Heirloom tomato tart or fancy pizza? Either way, super satisfying. Thin buttery pastry crust layered with parmesan, Old Amsterdam gouda, white cheddar, mounds of panko crisp & basil. This might be my new go to appetizer. And no soggy pastry thanks to @bakingsteel. See a full demo on my stories.

Did you hear Paris is snowing right now? Unfortunately NYC’s snow forecast just disappeared. Here’s my last great (only) snow memory this winter. Do I get bonus points for having @away luggage match the magical New Hampshire scenery situation? Look at those snow covered trees! 🌲🌲
I am in dire need of a vacation, I’m spent. Please tell me where you’re going so I can live vicariously through you and be inspired. Meanwhile I might continue sharing some of my favorite travels. Argentina glacier anyone?
*Oh and Happy St Patricks Day 🍀

Meyer Lemon Yogurt Parfait. Layers of meyer lemon perfumed yogurt, mango, meyer lemon supremes, granola and zest with a pinch of Maldon salt. Thanks for the fresh meyer lemons from Cali @peterbernheim @scottkolb 🍋!

Cozy cooking commencing! Beef Bourguignon is in progress for Christmas lunch, which is making the house smell amazing. Pretty sure this is a pic of chicken stew but it's motivating me to cook with the knowledge that there will be epic leftovers. Meanwhile we're also planning the rest of the meals for the holiday break... I'll share my brainstorming ideas on stories. Shortbread cookies, pumpkin cornbread, biscuits... Happy Christmas Eve 🎄 xo
'Tis the season for stuffed artichokes, sweaters and generally anything roasted.

Ever have one of those days you never stop moving & you're so tired you can't even think? Today was one of those days. No complaints but being human sucks sometimes. Wishing I had this at any point today: Citrus Glazed Grilled Chicken with Grilled Zucchini.
Farmstand Berry Skillet Cake. The fruit makes it versatile, cake for breakfast anyone? C'mon, confess you've all done it too. Recipe link in profile.

Memories of an amazing cocktail at @chardonarles last Spring. I have zero recollection of what it was & sadly forgot the guest chefs names too. But they were insanely talented & so are people behind Chardon, @theparispopup. So glad @armsfeelgood introduced me to this very cool crew in Arles. Happy Friday 🍹
A beautiful day to spend with wonderful friends while drinking bourbon & having a picnic at @woodfordreserve. A picturesque moment with @millercasale @faxmarks @scottkolb @oa2222 @janiedileo.
Wanted to share some recent work for @krupsusa. And this PSA: Whipped meyer lemon marscapone is good on everything! Especially on banana bread topped with honey, sliced almonds & mint.

So excited & honored to be part of a panel @cherrybombemag Marketplace 'How to be a Food Stylist' with @susanspungen @andreagentl @marianavelasquezv @njiacoi @janelarkworthy. So many women in food that I admire. Special thanks to @kerrybombe & Susan for including me. There are a few tickets left for tomorrow, link in profile. Ahhhhh, it’s my first panel, a teeny bit nervous! Hope to see you there.
👋 Fire Island. I'm going to miss these pretty pink skies. Good thing I have a few bajillion sunset & beach photos to last a while 😉. ✨ More on 👻
Gotta get my patriotic pie making in high gear. Decided my stripes might as well be stars too. @foodandwine recipe

Now that Summer finally got the memo, ready to put this on repeat... Seared Skirt Steak on @traegergrills with Charred Scallions and Corn Salad made with quinoa, jalapeño, red onion, parsley, cilantro, kewpie mayo, lime, sea salt and @tajinoficial seasoning. Toss in a smoked grapefruit margarita for good measure. 🍹
If you’re looking for a killer Father’s Day gift… Visit your local @traegergrills dealer before June 18th to get $100 off the Pro Series Grills (the one on my roof!) or $50 of Bronson & Tailgater 20 models.
Happy Valentine's Day 💗 It's not pink, but it's kind of romantic. Coconut Cake with Swiss Meringue Buttercream Roses. Recipe in profile. xoxo

Spent the morning at @whitneymuseum. Exactly what downtown needs! Come checkout

Needed a refreshing protein smoothie after @equinox yoga today. Strawberry, pineapple, @unsqgreenmarket Rainbow Microgreens, grassfed whey from @greecologies, unfiltered apple cider vinegar, hemp seeds and flax seeds. (For more smoothie ideas go to @thefeedfeed's website for my edited selection- link in profile)
Summer garden cake. Happy almost birthday @ericwbolyard. Can't wait to celebrate again Wednesday. Love you xx

Here’s one of my banana bread fails yesterday. One I’m considering a happy mistake due to the amazing banana caramel crisp texture. The second test was my first GF baking experience. It’s ok, you don’t learn a thing without a few fails in the kitchen, right? I've got so many ideas to fix it, but more on that later.
Ended the day with a gathering for @arthurstreetkitchen’s new fantastic 'Neighborhood' cookbook and a gorgeous @stgermaindrinks party on the @highlinenyc. All those amazing drinks washed away the baking fails of the day. More on stories. Ps. the floral installation at the St Germain party was pretty mind blowing.

This is all I’m dreaming about right now. Too much work means I REALLY need this juice party 🎉 What do you like to put in your juice? Some of my favorites: grapefruit, pomegranate, mint, parsley, watercress, lemon, ginger & peashoots. I'll be adding some juice recipes to the website soon.
Congrats

Spring is everywhere 👆🌿🌸 Gramercy Park East with a some new perspective. Now if only I could get one of those 🗝 to the park. Hmmmm, working on that. (For non NYC folk, Gramercy Park only gives 🔑 to residents living directly facing the park. Snooty & exclusive, damn right and I want one)
Golden hour at my friend Leah's beautiful horse farm. Makes me miss her & puts me in the mood for fall. 🍁Wishing you a wonderful Labor Day weekend.

Truffled egg custard tart in the making… Inspired by @privatepalate’s Truffle egg custards in egg cups last month. Made a lighter version of Thomas Keller’s custard recipe but put it in @marthastewart  @kerrygoldusa pate brisée pie shell (with very little salt).. Oh yeah and I got new pie cutters, baby leaves.🍁🍃🍂

If you haven't noticed I'm a little addicted to this rustic tart lately. I'm calling this version, Apple Tart with Ruffled Edges. It's just perfect for Thanksgiving.
First it's a single crust 'pie', therefore not too heavy after the most epic meal of the year with only 1 tbsp of sugar. Best of all it scores lots of pretty points with this frilly crust design but without a time consuming technique.
The recipe is on my website, link is above. Check out the full demo on my stories today. DM me if you have any questions and more importantly let me know if you plan to make it. I'll be making a few pear and apple versions myself, let's just say I'm grateful to have several Thanksgivings to drop in on. Hope you all have fun preparing for the best holiday 🦃. Happy Thanksgiving.
**full disclosure, this demo uses Granny Smith apples as a sub, and the skin was a little tough after baking. I suggest peeling Granny Smiths or follow the original directions in the recipe, I love how it turned out with Macouns (see my previous posts for that pic)
Sunset view overlooking the South Pacific with Gin & Tonics on standby. Giving me comfort while we have a snowy mix of sleet & freezing rain in NYC. Zapallar wins. Said while putting on snow boots 🙄.

Not your average chicken salad. Pomegranate Kale Salad with Crispy Chicken Thighs. Feels very Holiday 🎄 doesn't it? Totally in the mood after trimming the Christmas Tree & watching L❤️ve Actually. Who else put up their tree this weekend?

Me in my happy place, making this Apple Cardamom Pie with a Cable Knit Crust. @ladyofgrand captured & edited this beautiful mini 📽 as I was preparing to bring it to @thefeedfeed x @simplyorganicfoods friendsgiving at @kitchentablenyc a few weeks ago. I loved sharing this pie with Julie & Dan and the rest of the amazing group. Hope you’ll make this pie for your family & friends this Thanksgiving, recipe link in profile. Special thanks to Jolie, I absolutely love the video & 🎶. 🙏
This is happening... Setting up for a pancake brunch bar. 🍴 Be ready... @scottkolb @rachelsunae @faxmarks +

Who knew leeks could be this good! One of my best meals in Paris last month. 18 euro prefix lunch at Le Baratin, an unpretentious institution. Bought some leeks at @unsqgreenmarket in hopes to recreate this leek vinaigrette. The shaved egg on top was such a nice surprise.
The beautiful dining room at

Morning ritual... Water rooftop garden - aka schlep buckets of water, no water source 😁- and make a smoothie with something from the garden. Todays picks are thai basil & strawberries with plum, peach and bitters. Oh I love summer fruit

Women supporting women! Excited for today’s @womensmarch and the spirit that it brings. I hope you’ll check put my insta stories, I’m highlighting my friends, family & all the females that inspire me on a regular basis. We all need a boost from time to time!
I know I’m grateful for the encouragement I get, especially from all of you here. Thank You! It always warms my heart when I try something new and you support it. So... Let’s pick each other up, not because today’s the Women’s March, but let’s do it every day.
And yes, the pie has nothing to do with this except to convey that we should surround ourselves with things that make us happy! Happy Saturday. xo jude
Christmas came early thanks to @williamssonoma @amandahaascooks holiday preview party. Cashmere throw and @staub_usa mini, oh yes! Plus that peppermint bark, it's my kryptonite. Thank you 🎄❄️
Pretending Fall didn't screw us over & Winter decided to come after Summer. Well, at least it's Friday! Cheers 🍾🇺🇸! Tks for the bubbly @taittingerusa
Looking forward to brunching tomorrow. Yes, that's a verb.

I’m a lucky girl. @marcforgione and his brother Sean made a huge batch of homemade gnocchi with braised lamb and tomato sauce last night and I even scored some leftovers. Couldn’t resist adding a few poached eggs. But it makes me sad to look at this now and realize it’s all gone. (Bowl: @jonopandolfi)

Salted Caramel Cheddar Apple Pie adapted recipe from @birdsblack. Forgot to put @Kerrygoldusa Dubliner cheddar cheese in the crust, so I put it in the pie, why not! Agree with my fellow ig baker friends, pre-bake pics are the best.

Today @feedmedearly spoiled me rotten. We grilled a few @eatmeaty strip steaks with scallions & asparagus. Which we proceeded to shamelessly eat straight off the carving board dipped in @jacobsensaltco sea salt 🙈. Zero silverware, zero pics, zero regrets. This is a picture of the steak we didn't devour 😂. Seriously, Jess, you're amazing. Thanks for coming over to cook for me and sharing some laughs. @traegergrills @traegerculinary

Slow cooked scrambled eggs and scallions, bacon and avocado smash. A view I'd very much like to have right now. Instead I'm currently cooking a team lunch for the office and pretty psyched for the ricotta, chia seed pudding & strawberry parfaits I just made for dessert. (On my stories) But I could pull one off for brekkie right?
Aspen vibes at @roundhousebeacon last night. Cozy situation, check ✔️
Spoiled rotten by @rusticjoyfulfood today, who made us ridiculously tasty treats at her
Gimme all the succulents especially the aloe cactus. Oh & that top right cluster - they call them chicks n hens, seriously 😂.

Garlicky chive blossoms over Chimichurri Pork Chops with Couscous and Fresh Peas. Counting down to the days when the farmers market will be full of chive blossoms, peas and coriander flowers (not pictured but so heavenly). Or warm evenings lit up by fireflies and the subtle sound of crickets. I’m obviously over this cold weather 😂. Recipe link in profile.

Just wanted to share some bts photos from “How to make a decorative pie” Periscope video I made w Julie of @thefeedfeed and Driscolls. And my vodka pie crust recipe can be found on my website. (www.facebook.com/thejudylab link in profile too 👆)
I did it! Not so bad considering how cold it was. Now that it's over, I'll admit never ran 4 miles in my life. Whoo hoo. Maybe I like running now?!?

I’m clutching a tissue box 🤧 but I’m still ready for the weekend! Are you? 🥂🥡🥃🍽🍿🍸🍾🍷

Green smoothie with granola. I found this pic from a while back using @miraevnine’s amazing homemade granola. This may be my favorite granola ever (mira, will you share the recipe with me??). On heavy lunch / dinner rotation lately: Roasted chicken & roasted tomato sauce that I'm going to now call Prosecco Chicken 😂. Very luxurious 🥂. I made the sauce stovetop on the chicken sheet pan scraping up the chicken schmaltz aka pan droppings, adding @mionettoproseccousa to deglaze, half & half, sea salt and the garlic, shallot, thyme roasted tomatoes. Tip*Skip parchment paper or else it's hard to make the pan sauce and don't trim all the fat off the chicken. I'll share the demo I made while cooking this last week on Instagram stories today. Best part! It's a 30 min dinner.

Part II: Peach Pie. @unsqgreenmarket peaches and my favorite @PamAnderson3mc blue ribbon pie crust recipe. Inspired by @julesfood and her Ina Garten butter/shortening crusts, def need to try that recipe too.

New Summery smoothie combo: Fresh apricots, leftover grilled pineapple, orange, ginger, hemp seeds, bee pollen, flax seeds. Super sweet from the grilled pineapple. Ended up adding some kale and collard greens afterwards to make a green smoothie. @vitamix

I joined a fun series called 'What's in your fridge' with @purewow & @GEappliances. Being a food stylist, the fridge is my most utilized appliance. I did style it a bit but the contents are all there. On shoot days it tends to be packed, have you seen a fridge filled with ingredients for 14 recipes?! Not so photogenic 😂. Fun fact, I used to keep at least 5lbs of cheese on hand for my last weekly recipe column job, 🤦🏻‍♀️!
Real talk, raise your hand if your door is full of condiments 🙋🏻‍♀️! I say hot sauce, little jars of pickled jalapeños and kewpie mayo forever - the shallow door shelving helps keep things hyper organized. Per usual there's a lot of butter (I’m in the middle of several baking projects & I can’t wait to share them with you) plus loads more in the freezer with my bone broth obsession. When possible I fill the fridge with lots of kale, citrus and ginger for smoothies, white wine, tomato paste and crème fraîche for sauces. On good days there’s leftover roast chicken, I’m team cold ckn all the way! And lucky me, Mom recently sent me homemade kimchi. I don't do a lot of

Happy Saturday! Interrupting your morning coffee & eggs for a moment to highlight @nokidhungryny, a charity organization that I’m proud to be an ambassador for. This is Share Our Strength’s national campaign to end childhood hunger in America. Their big fund raising event 'Taste of the Nation’ is held on Mon 4/25 in NYC. Please join me to support them by buying a ticket (20% discount using the clickable link in my profile, discount code: TOTNJudyLab http://ce.strength.org/events/nyc-taste-nation). Please feel free to share the code. There will be 30 restaurants and 10 bars (tagging some in this pic) all to help fight childhood hunger = translates to amazing food & more boozy cocktails than you can handle, ha ha. Happy to support this awesome event and my friend & Chef @leahscohen of @pigandkhao as one of the hosts of the night. I hope you’ll join in. Please let me know if you decide to attend, it’s a lot fun. I’ll see you there! Happy Saturday everyone, please resume all brunching activities. 🍳@lodgeCastiron Skillet Eggs with Asparagus, Spring Peas, Bacon Lardons, Easy blender Hollandaise Sauce for your viewing pleasure.

Pie pastry ready to be chilled before assembling a pie. I like to shape the leaves, as they would look in nature. A bit of a curve or a bend gives them texture too. Same with flowers, I like to shape them for a 3-D feel and make imprints using a tool made for fondant simulating the folds and striations.
🍃To save space before placing in the freezer I use parchment to create multiple single layers of pastry. And use one of my favorite tools, a quarter sheet pan. I thought it was a frivolous purchase years ago but I use them endlessly. Don’t you fret, I am human... I have plenty of other frivolous kitchen tools 🙋🏻‍♀️🤦🏻‍♀️.
*Answer to my most common question: I usually use @williamssonoma pie cutters. They make adorable seasonally shapes too. A photo from my last pie workshop, I hope to do it again soon. Thanks for the continued inquiries, you’ll be the first to know when I organize my next one. 😘

A recipe I wrote for @delish, link in profile. *On a separate note: I wrote a post yesterday that I removed in fear that it was misunderstood. Please know that my thoughts are with Florida, Texas and Mexico these days. I mentioned climate change, but not intending to take away from the hardship that families are experiencing. Do you ever get that feeling that you write something on Instagram and when it doesn’t get a certain reaction, you feel stupid about it? I generally keep it pretty light here, but I couldn’t just delete and pretend I didn’t. There is a lot of chatter about being authentic, and it can be easy to sweep things under the rug. I just wanted be honest about it. So sorry if it sounded preachy. Thanks for listening. Stay strong and stay safe Florida! xoxo

These peony varieties always capture my attention. Even at a young age I always loved flowers. One day I surprised my Mom with a beautiful bouquet of flowers picked from the garden.
Little did I know that I wasn’t supposed to pick flowers from gardens all over the neighborhood 🙊. She was mortified.
I recall walking house to house to apologize at the scene of each crime. In the process I think all was forgiven (I hope) and a few of those kind neighbors ended up teaching me little things about flowers. I’ll never forget learning that the big purple flowers that I called a microphones were called hyacinths.
I always love learning about flowers and expanding my knowledge. I was introduced to peonies when I worked at my first flower shop job and in turn I introduced them to my Mom. It has been our favorite flower ever since. 🌿

The pre-ramen shot is pretty too. Plus, I'm into this color palette. 🍜🌱🍽 In other news, I've been working on re-branding my business for the past few months and I'm finally getting close. At this point in time, growing creatively and learning how to better express myself feels like a necessary and natural progression. It's equally important for personal and business reasons {I've had sluggish moments because I felt pigeonholed, have you ever felt that?}
🌱While I want to share my food styling more intensely, I want to highlight my other skills in a cohesive way. I want to show how they work in harmony (although sometimes it feels disheveled). Most importantly I’m doing this for myself, to push myself, fearlessly try new things, work with new clients in unusual ways, use my mixed bag of tricks to create something beautiful… basically be a part of the art direction.
🌱I never thought it would be easy, but there are so many little decisions, some simple, some daunting.
The creative details are fun... customized fonts, website layouts, color palettes and motifs for logos, new business cards etc. But then there's the nitty gritty... new website domaine, changing all the emails because of said domaine change, new Instagram domaine (whoa! that was the hardest one to decide - still finalizing), updating/changing all your social platforms and deciding how to roll it out.
🌱If you've been in this situation, I would love to know your suggestions for making this transition. Any tips to make this feel sane are greatly appreciated. I’m happy to return the favor. I haven't even started the photo edit for an updated portfolio, that's a whole different beast. But I’m getting there one step at a time and am super pumped! I’ll share more as I continue the process. {sorry for the novel 😴} xoxo

🌟Pie Workshop🌟I'm so excited to share the news of my first Pie Baking & Styling Workshop in NYC. Whether you're looking to improve your pie skills, never baked before and want to work more on styling while eating pie, or let's admit it... just want a gram-worthy pie, please join us! It's an intimate group of 3 per class at my home studio. I really want to emphasis that this should feel special & personal, particularly since these are my first classes.
🌿Sat Feb 3rd has only 1 ticket left so I've added Sun Feb 4th. All the details are on my website, link below. Look at the itinerary section for the topics we'll discuss & take note of the one-on-one session for an Instagram portfolio review. I'm so excited to bake with you.

🎄 If you're interested in buying a class as a Christmas gift, I can email you a gift card just in time! Happy Holidays. xo judy {note: Feb 4 is also Super Bowl Sunday - but we'll be done at 5pm & you can bring your pie with you!}

Happy 1st day of Spring!! I went to the flower market yesterday and I couldn’t resist these adorable pansies. Did you know these beauties are edible? So cute on cakes and salads. I grow them from organic seed on my roof top or balcony (convenient and saves $) or buy them from the farmers market.
🌿 This year I'm determined to start the garden much earlier (hopefully much of it from seed) and figure out a method to farm the roof smarter than in the past. I'd love to be in touch with someone who specializes in urban rooftop gardening. Anyone up for experimenting with some methods to collect rainwater (without a gutter, oye)? Setting up a heat shield (think sunglasses for a garden bed)? NYC roof top farming has a whole set of different issues in addition to regular gardening… evaporation, extreme heat exposure, plus I don't have a water source up there - so my job title continues to be 'Professional Schlepper'. Thank god for my partner & neighbor Stephanie.
🌿 I clearly need help! If you know anyone, would you please let me know in the comments below or send me a dm/email? All advice welcome. I’ve learned a lot but we need to up our game. ☃️ Oh, and don't forget your snow boots tomorrow, yikes!

Fingers crossed, hope to ✨announce✨ a new line of workshops on my website today. Plus the option for gift card purchases, perfect if you still need a gift for the holidays. But before I do so, I'm doing a little extra homework to make sure that I bring value to every workshop I teach.
✨They will vary between two and three people with options to select from & plenty of discussion topics too. The hard part will be picking what you want to focus on. Will it be decorating a cake like this coconut wedding cake I made recently, which is perfect for a birthday {if you don't eat it yourself, bring it to your special occasion}. How to make one of my decorative pies. Or how to plan & make a dinner that's perfect for entertaining along with florals.
✨ Here's the big question! Do you want to focus on styling or baking/cooking? Can't decide, want to spend time on both? We're offering 1 & 2 day curriculums. I know it's tough to squeeze in all the topics, but I hope by presenting a customizable class structure for your intimate group, we will make sure that it's right just for you. Some may want to spend more time on social media. We can do that regardless of the

Rustic Pie Dough. A recipe that came together on a hot & humid Summer day in Charleston. Not exactly the conditions you think of with pastry. It's a no fuss recipe that's great for rustic pies, tarts or galettes.
I call it rustic because it's made with your own two hands, no machinery. It happens quickly with no prep time. Typically I like to cut the butter in advance and freeze it overnight, but we didn't do that and it was just fine. Butter straight from the fridge. Good ingredients means good results. I use European cultured unsalted butter from @vermontcreamery. 86% butterfat, it makes a difference.
The recipe is on my website, link in profile. But if you want to make decorative pie, stick to my vodka pie crust, also on my site. Hope this encourages you to make some Peach or Heirloom Tomato pie while the produce is still around. I know I want to!

Cannot believe it's been 14 years. I'll never forget that day, especially running up to my roof to see it for myself. It was surreal to see the twin towers engulfed in smoke. Living in soho was extremely difficult because of the heavy smoke that was suffocating us. Every business had to shutdown and there was a mass exodus. It was scary on so many levels. I was also unemployed at the time and I was terrified, thank god the economy turned around. So proud of NYC for rebuilding from a devastating day.

Finally sharing a recipe for my version of homemade Instant Ramen loaded with lots of toppings like baby bok choy, carrots, cilantro, kimchi, scallions, radishes, enoki mushrooms, lemons and black sesame. Oh, and can't forget a 6 min egg with an oozy yolk. Ramen broth traditionally takes days, but I like making a homemade version by adding a few things to chicken stock to give it a nice umami flavor like dried kombu. Let me know what you think. Recipe is on my website http://thejudylab.com/kombu-ramen

File under things I want on snowy winter days. Unfortunately cooking for myself has not been top priority lately. Work is kicking my butt, but in the best way possible. Rolling out some meal planning to fold in some better eating habits when things are busy. My fridge is packed with food for work. Hoping cooking things in advance will help. If you have any rituals you like when you’re really busy, I’d love to know!

I just returned home from my 3rd Thanksgiving celebration. I feel lucky I got to see both friends & family to celebrate my favorite holiday! I love the little moments... drinking wine in a crammed kitchen while someone stirs the gravy, talking about the latest news in our lives while we chop onions. Bonus, thursday night included an epic game night of Celebrity. The kind where your face & belly hurt so much, but you never want it to stop. Priceless.
✨I'm so grateful for the many things that makes my life full... loving friends and family, the community of artists that I admire and get to be a part of, the creative work (with less & less boundaries 🙌🏻) that I found as a second career and the countless friends who help make it happen, the failures that helped me self-correct to lead to some winning moments this year or just face harsh realities, the incredible clients that I love working with, and the people I meet that motivate me to share more of what I do and inspire me to be to more unique.
✨Feeling washed all over with joy this past week. I'm so impressed by the bakers who have shared their creations during Thanksgiving that were inspired by a photo, video or recipe I posted on Instagram. They all looked so incredibly beautiful & tasty! All the tarts, pies, macarons even! Made me feel so proud. So, I realize I'm thankful for Instagram, a place that brings likeminded people together and builds a community of creatives. I was also blown away by all the people who came to our marketplace(s), all powered by @instagram btw!! Loved meeting you all 💕. Thank you for following along, taking time to comment (I swear, I always read them 💗) and sharing how we connect. Have a wonderful weekend. Photo from a previous family gathering at @kitchentablenyc.

I am a food stylist by profession, but I love when I get an opportunity to work with flowers. I've got 26 arrangements under my belt in less than a week after my recent @Sothebys job. Today I began prep for a food styling job which also needs a botanical touch and am so excited that I can help bring food to life by setting the atmosphere.
🌿
I used to get hung up that I didn't specialize in just food. But now I embrace the fact that I work differently than others and appreciate every opportunity to create something beautiful whether its food, props or florals. I have been using every arsenal in my background from my original career in luxury fashion to a high school/college floral job.
🌿
So I say crush the doubts in your mind. Listen to your gut. Trust your instincts. Try new things. Do what makes you feel electric. Be passionate. Be fearless. Go all out. I didn't attend the @cherrybombe jubilee in SF but I heard the messages loud and clear. You gals motivate me and a whole hell of a lot of other ladies. **Let me know if you relate to these thoughts & tag a friend you think might too. It's only Monday but I'm fired up. 💪

Coconut birthday cake 🌿
The backstory: I made this cute little two layer coconut birthday cake for @alice_gao. It was part of the batter I was testing for my friends @scottkolb & @faxmarks wedding cake. I had a store bought bday gift in mind, but when given the opportunity I always prefer a homemade gift. It feels more personal. In fact, each time I create a cake it’s very personal to me. It’s an opportunity to design something unique. I never anticipated that baking would be so rewarding and become such a creative form of expression in my life. This cake was tiny, but it has a full size personality.
✨I don’t always have time to make birthday, engagement, wedding, baby shower cakes for my friends and family but I sure wish I did.
💡Tip: always make tester cakes with batter so you can taste it without cutting into the actual cake you serve. If you bake the tester in advance you can tweak the batter if needed. I normally use a muffin pan, but I used @staub_usa mini cocottes, for this mini cake.
Recipe link in profile.

I took the plunge, today I'm @judy.kim. The change feels similar to my approach on pie, new & uniquely mine. But I’m most excited for the rebranding and taking the ambiguity out of my profession. A creative website that displays my business in it’s entirety... food styling, recipe testing & development, prop styling, floral design, art direction, visual content strategy and soon workshops.

Morning & Evening meditation inspiration. Trying to kickstart a practice (again). Do you prefer morning or evening meditation? Any tips? Would love your thoughts. ✨
Working for yourself often requires discipline. Being exhausted & busy is the opposite of what I want to achieve. Doesn't happy & accomplished sound much more appealing? Recently I've put limits on how many hours I work, finally established days off (sans guilt), more rest & playtime with friends, forging habits to be more time efficient for said playtime, reduced screen time and more sleep. I thought I'd add meditation into the mix. *Not saying I'm winning at all of these things, quite the opposite but I am trying. Who knew that striving for life balance would be so hard. Honestly it's harder than starting my second career. I hope you'll share your own struggles or tips. 🙏

When @haveanoliveday asked me to create a recipe using beautiful Spanish olives, it made me think of my time in Northern Spain. I particularly miss San Sebastián and Mallorca. I wanted to create a dish that wasn’t your typical olive recipe. But most importantly something that had dimension and texture. Spaghetti with Green Olives, Pancetta and Crispy Lemon Breadcrumbs. It’s bright, briny, crunchy and creamy all at the same time. While it won’t magically teleport me back to Spain, I can hear the clear blue water crashing on the beach if I close my eyes. The imagination is a wonderful thing, isn’t it! I hope you enjoy it, I loved creating it. Recipe below.

Jook, or what some call Congee. There is something so beautiful in this simple dish, especially since it’s warm and comforting. No perfect recipe exists, so you can’t muck it up. Simmer cooked rice, 3:1 filtered water to rice ratio, until it’s broken down. If it’s pre-cooked 🍚 it usually takes 30-45 min, adding water as needed to desired consistency. Make extra for leftovers. I like mine thick, hot and bubbling served with cold kimchi or even just plain. I bet a jammy soft boiled would be amazing too. If you come to my house, it’s always on the menu, available upon request. 🥣

It was a long week of continued nitty gritty re-branding work & website redesign that includes a streamlined check out process for my Pie Baking & Styling Workshop Feb 3 & 4 in NYC. It wasn’t built properly to begin with but I was so excited to get it announced. Nevertheless, I’m so excited for my first workshop. Oye, I had some ticketing snafu’s, so tickets are still available. Come join me!
🌟The Pie Workshop will include techniques to make decorative pies whether you have very little time or patience to a full afternoon and want a more detailed design. I’ve been changing my philosophy on pie making, I’ve been finding ways to make it easier and without all the fussy rules that are usually deemed critical. You guys seem into that too, I love how many Apple & Pear Tarts with a Ruffled Edge I’ve seen since Thanksgiving! I break a lot of rules in my pie crusts lately but they turn out great, I can’t wait to show them to you. Especially the new milk pie crust I made over the holidays, a new favorite and it does’t require anything but your hands.
🌟The workshop has only 3 students, so we’ll get really into your baking questions and make multiple pies if there is time. Mini pies are a great way to test out new designs. I hope you’ll take advantage of the cozy set up at my home studio where we get to focus on you, it might be a while before I get to teach this intimate class again based on my work schedule.
🌿All the details are on my website, link above. Look at the itinerary section for the topics we'll discuss & take note of the one-on-one session for an Instagram portfolio review or frankly anything you’d like to discuss. I'm so excited to bake with you. It will be delicious especially with sponsors like @vermontcreamery, more fun sponsors will be shared soon too, stay tuned. Happy Sunday! *Special thank you to @the.hawkes for all your help this week & getting things fixed up! Pie skills, YES. Technology, not so much! ***Second tech fail, sorry the profile link was broken & fixed now.

Is it possible to see light in the darkness we feel today? There's an invisible veil that's suffocating me. I didn't sleep last night. Woke up hourly in a panic. I literally feel sick that a racist, bigot and sexual predator who is fueled with hatred has taken our most powerful elected position. A shocking contrast to President Obama & @hillaryclinton that embrace minorities, the LGBTQ & female community. I feel numb. I feel heartbroken. I truly thought in this day & age we could elect a female president. We have so much work to do. We need to be an active participant in making change. We clearly need to repair our country. Truthfully I know I'm gonna be useless today, mourn our country. One that my parents worked so hard to immigrate to, one that gave my brothers and I the generous & privileged lives we live. I will be eating my feelings today. But tomorrow I hope to figure how I, one person, can make a difference in this shit show that is the USA. If you have any ideas of how to do that, please let me know 🙏. (photo was taken in Africa near Mt Kilimanjaro, a place I'd very much prefer to be right now. Never would I realize climbing a mountain would be easier than accepting today's fate)

I’ve been stressed and overly scheduled, so I’ll admit it… I’m scrambling to be ready for the workshop and finish deadlines, therefore I’ve been posting on Instagram at the weirdest hours. Clearly not good for a successful post, but oh well! No one is perfect. Knowing I’ll be focused on pie making with some fellow bakers all weekend is helping me get through the week. I can’t wait to generally geek out and talk about pie dough and technique. It may seem that I focus on the decorative details, but I think the technique is the most important. We’re going to try my new milk pie dough recipe. I’m making it by hand lately, I’ve been shying away from using a food processor to simplify the process and I love it! I don’t follow all the typical rules like frozen butter (gasp!) and show you how I make it work for me. If you can’t be here in person, please follow along on stories. It’s going to be fun!

I'm curious, would you call this an Heirloom Tomato Slab Pie or Tart? Heirloom tomatoes on buttery pâte brisée pastry with layers of goat cheese and parmesan. I forgot garlic, but I'd normally grate fresh garlic with the layers of cheese before adding the tomatoes. I like salting the 🍅 in advance to bring out their flavor and draw out the moisture. I threw some chopped basil to finish it, but wouldn't basil oil would be killer on this?

I’ve been updating my website for the last few days. Holy Crap! Overwhelmed and happy in equal measure. Photos bring back a lot of good memories & needless to say, a stroll down memory lane is pretty damn humbling (the good, the bad and the ugly). But l learn a lot when I see images, there’s always something to tinker with.

I've learned to ask friends for advice to gain perspective & expertise when needed. Created a mini network of cooks, stylists and photographers where I feel safe to admit my failures to, seriously priceless. I don’t talk about this much, but I am self-taught in the world of styling & photography and think that’s why I spend so much time working and obsess about learning. Every small thing I learn feels like a big win (usually stemming from a flop). Just takes time and patience. Currently trying to better balance work and time spent with friends, one of the infinite lessons to learn when working for yourself. (Work = time suck.) All you wonderful people I have seen so little of over the past few years while figuring out the freelance world, I miss you and definite have not forgotten you. (No idea what brought on this very long post, tks if you’re still reading.)
Recently I found I’m really enjoying my work and feeling brave enough to stretch my comfort zone. Working with florals a lot and it nicely breaks up my food related work. Perhaps implied but don’t think I ever said that I was writing a weekly recipe column for @delish *tks to @annawatsoncarl. Talk about a challenge. 15 months later & 325-ish recipes, I’m a little zapped. Grateful for that AWESOME opportunity but also excited to have time for other projects… hopefully much more travel. Here’s an idyllic scene from a French vineyard in Provence last Spring - I came back so refreshed and creative after that 3 week trip. I’ll be sharing trips on a new travel portfolio like Provence, Kilimanjaro and Patagonia, but the moment there’s just a sweet collection from Paris, so come back soon. Meanwhile I hope you’ll take a peek at the new site and enjoy, link in profile. Happy Friday and cheers to all you badasses who are suicidal enough to be a freelancer! xoxo Jude 🥂

A reminder to take a vacation soon. Capri, Italy 2009. I remember this day like it was yesterday. It was my first day in Capri. I took an evening hike and came to this clearing amongst the trees. The sun was giving off such a beautiful glow that washed all over the Faraglioni rocks. So befitting, the name derives from latin and means lighthouse. It’s still one of my favorite holidays.

An outtake from this weekends food styling workshop on my favorite new surface from @ericksonwoodworks. Himalayan Sea Salt, a custom board developed with Ginny. Isn't it pretty?✨Thanks to everyone who came Saturday and for the warm welcome. Loved meeting you all. ✨We set up this potato leek soup in the demo. We talked about color composition and creating textures by layering varied toppings on the soup (some for color, crunch, always for taste), placing torn bread and a beautiful swipe of butter, prop selection (shape, size, depth), photo surfaces, abbreviated discussion about my food styling kit etc. Looking forward to doing more workshops in the future. We spent our last night in Vermont at @shelburnefarms. A beautiful 1400 acre non-profit education center & working farm. Their ethos is incredible and I can't wait to learn more.
We witnessed their adorable children's program teaching kids where food comes from and the children's farmyard. A walk around the grounds brought us to this hilltop view with an array of the cheeses they produce on site & flowers from their gardens.
After being hosted graciously by @vermontcreamery we were rewarded with a joint dinner that was vegetarian, based on what is grown at Shelburne Farms. Truly a special evening. Thank you!

Sometimes flaky pastry leaves make their way into my eggs. Unfortunately today is not that day. I might be drinking a @goindiegresh green juice RN but it doesn’t mean I’m not thinking about this. If you decide to make this, cook the farro and cauliflower in stock for flavor. And if you’re like me, there’s always leftover pastry leaf cut outs in my freezer. Of course I’m fully aware that is not normal, but you should try it anyway.

Instead of a green smoothie, opted for a hot green soup today. It's really a clean out the fridge kinda soup… kale, broccoli, swiss chard, frozen peas, white beans, celery, avocado oil, garlic, chicken stock, chili flakes & finished w @atthemeadow smoked alaska salt. Yesterday I made @arthurstreetkitchen’s Seedy Soba Noodles with Asian Herbs and Sweet Ginger Dressing from her new book called ’Neighborhood'. I took this just before I mixed all the goodness together. Just look at all that texture and freshness. It's been an amazing week of parties and yesterday we finally got to enjoy this Coconut Wedding Cake to celebrate @scottkolb @faxmarks. And what a party it was 🎉! One for the record books.
It's one of two cakes I made. This is covered in Swiss Meringue Buttercream roses, chrysanthemums, ranunculus and a few real flowers for a bit of contrast.
This was my first Gluten Free baking escapade. I used @cup4cup to keep it simple (I find GF recipes with multiple flours overwhelming) and pleased it turned out quite well. A bit denser than the regular cake, but good flavor. Does anyone have a tip to lighten up the texture?

This may of been the best day ever in my book. For those who don't know, my original career is in Fashion, while my passion is Food. While working with @kitchentablenyc I've been so fortunate to be a part of the great events that take place there and meet fantastic creative people in all industries, particularly food. This was the perfect day where Fashion & Food & Styling came together. @VogueMagazine filmed "73 Questions with Blake Lively" at The Kitchen Table, which was already awesome, but then I was hired to be the food stylist since Blake is an amazing cook and wanted a cooking scene. I feel so lucky to have been given this opportunity and was thrilled just to be a part of the shoot. Thank you Grace and Vogue! Please check out www.facebook.com/TheKitchenTableNYC for a link to the video. It's super adorable. I'll post some behind the scenes pics soon. (Btw, we shot this in the beginning of May and lips were sealed as Blake is the August Vogue cover girl. Lets just say it was brutal keeping this quiet till now)

Today felt like the first day of true relaxation. I'm grateful for good friends that have checked in on me. The news was grim this week when I realized my pulled calf muscle was actually a grade 2 tear.
Yep, it's kinda ugly. It has improved very little and is forcing me to rest even more at home. But I'm choosing to find the silver lining.
I'm spending my time sleeping, recreating healthy rituals, spending quality time via phone or in person with friends and next will be creating better time efficient work habits so I can sustain these new healthy habits. I've let work takeover for too long.
Meanwhile special thanks to @janiedileo for bringing me a healthy @sweetgreen salad for dinner last night, @jessica.l.quinn who brought me this delicious @poketownny bowl today and @faxmarks @scottkolb who brought rosé to enjoy on the roof aka Summer Water 💦.

Happy Thanksgiving! Arrived at my brother’s house in Boston with Layla just in time to see this beautiful sunset. It’s been a hectic (sleepless) week of work and I’m so happy I had this little fruit loop companion while I tried desperately to stay awake on the car ride (2 coffees and windows down for a rush of cold winter air barely did the trick). I’ve been a little quieter than usual on Instagram lately, but wanted to let you know I love and read every single comment even if I’m slow to respond. I’m so thankful for this amazing community, even more thankful I’ve had a chance to meet many of you from all over the world IRL. Right now I’m sitting next to my brother, of course we’re both staring at a computer or phone screen, but nonetheless I’m hanging out with family and we’re together. Reflecting on the year and I’m so grateful for wonderful friends and family that I can never spend enough time with. There have been incredible and creative work opportunities that came this year. Damn. It still shocks me that I get to do what I do for work, lucky me! More importantly there have been countless people who have helped me improve all sides of my business and hopefully a few that I’ve helped a long the way too. I’m working on updating my apt to make it feel equal parts home and work studio. I want to make it function for all the needs of my crazy upside down life, but it’s a life I wouldn’t trade anything for. Hope you guys have a warm and delicious Thanksgiving! Ok, Ok enough sappiness, gotta make pie…specifically experimenting with a new Pumpkin Pie + Cream Cheese Swirl. Lots of love to you.

Woke up early to make an Heirloom Tomato Tart. This time it will be layered with Vermont White Cheddar and Old Amsterdam Gouda Cheese, maybe Parmesan too. It will be full of flavor! I received a lot of questions about how to avoid a soggy crust on the last several tomato tart posts, step by step tips are up on Instagram stories today. But my top tips are seasoning lightly with sea salt to draw out water & add flavor, I use @jacobsensaltco and I often bake it on a @bakingsteel. Can't wait to share this.

Driving up to Beacon as we speak and the temp is🌡dropping by the second...Brrrr ❄️. So looking forward to putting the week behind me. I see a weekend filled with cozy sweaters/slippers, lots of wine and cooking up some treats for my friends. Craving buttermilk biscuits after making yesterday's skillet pot pie. It really reminded me how much I love to cook from scratch. It's been ages since I made pie dough 😳. Honestly I made a total mess, flour was everywhere😂. But it was so cathartic, I really needed it. 😊 More importantly it was fun! This week had major work set backs (plural) - my biggest to date and it caused a lot of sleepless nights (also plural). I'm learning to accept failure. Frankly it sucks. But I'm moving on and enjoying a weekend off. I think we all deserve that. Sorry, for the loooong post. Have a wonderful weekend. I'll hopefully share some biscuits with you later this weekend. xoxo

My Pie Baking & Styling Workshop in NYC is coming up soon and I couldn’t be more excited. I swear I work on a bit of it every day. As a stylist, I want the setting to look beautiful with pretty table top items and flowers, one that will let you to be creative. As a food stylist, I want the food to look beautiful so you can capture images and learn to art direct and compose your own unique style. As a cook, I want to serve a seasonal heart warming lunch. As a baker, I want you to enjoy a hands on class and walk away with every pie & tart making skill I can possibly share. As a small business owner, I want to help you apply social media, branding and marketing skills that feel natural to you. I can’t wait to entertain in my space and welcome you. Oh and we’ll make sure you have a killer pie to share on Pi Day ;)
🌿I’m also so thrilled to announce the sponsors, many are good friends that I have known for years and will provide items unique to their amazing businesses. @oxo kitchen tools, @vermontcreamery butter and cheese, @ericksonwoodworks Ginny and I designed special surfaces for this event, @jacobsensaltco flaky sea salt & kosher salt, @aplatesf for chic totes to take your pie creations home. Thank you so much for your generous support and the many gift items I cannot wait to share.
🌿Pie Workshop tickets are still available, come join us Feb 3rd or 4th. Details and itinerary info are on my website, link in profile. DM with any questions. {Apple & Blood Orange Garden Trellis Pie, recipe on my website} Xo jude

If I were to write a guide of places to eat in Austin, @confituras would be at the top. The best biscuit I’ve ever had. Big statement, but true. Meet Stephanie, owner & founder, seen here offering her amazing biscuit - do you see all those layers!?! Please go visit her, support this local female owned business. Stephanie, I’ll be back next time I’m in Austin.

Today was all about getting work done. Took a little break from social media. Just one 👻 in the middle of my evening run to reflect on a how good it feels to get things accomplished. Photos edited, recipe column written and multiple conference calls this week with the hopes of getting some personal projects off the ground that I feel very passionate about. I never thought I'd enjoy my work this much, let alone transition into a new career. Creativity feels limitless for now and I want to enjoy every second. But reality is harsh. I TRIED to slow down and spent the last 4 weeks freaking out about EVERYTHING. Finally (& luckily) things are settling down, I'm getting organized and back to work. ✨ So cheers to every single person who is a creative small business owner. I feel privileged to be a part of the club. I respect you all because I now know first hand how freakin hard it is. This Popsicle Cocktail is for ALL of us. We deserve it.

Blank canvas. 2018, I'm coming for you and ready to get over some of the stupid hang ups 2017 developed. Unfortunately I bowed out of this Jan's big trip to NZ & Thailand. In 2016 we climbed Kilimanjaro, in 2017 we hiked Perito Moreno Glacier and Patagonia, Chile. Aside from their immeasurable beauty, they were also great times to reflect while unplugged from reality. I worked out a lot of shit up there.
✨This year is different! I'll start out working on a photoshoot on January 2nd 💪. Why is this worth mentioning? While I've had food writing/misc assignments, I historically didn't book one photoshoot in January (admitting this was terrifying btw). Of course there are food styling shoots all year, but I'm taking this as a good omen that things are shifting after starting my business only a few years ago 🤘.
✨I'm 'less' afraid and seeking out the kind of work I desire. Why are we, especially freelancers, 2x especially women, afraid to seek out what we want? Many thanks to @fwscout for so much wise advice. I'm so inspired by those around me! It's getting better, but fear still gets in the way, isn't it exhausting? While I won't be reflecting on a mountain this January, I'm getting a head start on this mountain called December, have you heard of it? Making room for 2018, so back to the beginning... blank canvas. Let me know if you relate. 🙏

Pie, it's been on my mind a lot lately. What design? What kind? What crust? Should I develop another recipe? Working on some pie related projects and I can't wait to share them with you.

Dumplings and Kimchi. What else do you need? Had so much fun cooking for a few days with my Mom, thankfully before I fell really ill (only got to enjoy a few of these yesterday). So grateful that she passed down her passion for food. Years ago I started writing down her Korean recipes as I feared she’d forget her original recipes. She doesn’t cook as much anymore, I think she’s earned the right to take a break!?! We’ve done a couple of weeks of intensive cooking and writing together, but it's been on hiatus and need to bring it back. I didn’t have a website at the time but I’m hoping to share some of my favorite recipes to you in the near future. (btw - these are the Mandoo dumplings I made on Snapchat yesterday, Mom and I still like the ‘pushy pushy’ method we created vs the fancy folds) 👻=thejudylab

Filled my @staub_usa skillet with fruit filling, placed strips of @vermontcreamery (high butter fat 💕) pie dough across & sprinkled 🌟 @williamssonoma star pastry cutouts. Don't forget to dot filling with bits of butter & brush pastry with heavy cream before baking (I prefer it to egg wash for the lighter golden color). I used @bobsredmill tapioca flour to get the right level of fruit filling gooeyness, very important.
I baked mine at 350f in my @traegergrills outside, so cool right! (But you can also bake in the oven)

It was a busy week of pie making. Here's one I made for Thanksgiving day, Apple & Cranberry with my Vodka Pie Crust. It has a nice balance of tartness from the cranberries, subtle sweetness from the orange juice/zest and a bit of je ne sais quoi from aromatic bitters.
✨It's also my first herringbone pattern. Looks more reg lattice than herringbone, but not terrible. I definitely had to concentrate a bit to keep track. But it’s fun to experiment and figure out what I’ll do differently to improve it… slightly wider strips (less to cut & keep track of 😉) and float the herringbone pattern over 2 strips instead of 3 to help make it more pronounced. I approach it like a little game.
✨I have another Instagram Stories tutorial I'm putting together for this when the recipe is ready. Did you like the detailed tutorial from last week for the Apple Tart with Ruffled Edges? It was longer than usual, so I'm curious to know your feedback. Comment below or feel free to DM if you prefer. I put up a sneak peek of the tutorial on stories today. Have a great Monday.

Homemade cream of mushroom soup. Funny, as a kid I never would have fathomed this soup not coming from a Campbell's soup can. Don't get me wrong, my Mom was a cook from scratch kinda Mom but she always tried what was trending (I blame the coupon craze). Dehydrated potato au gratin, Spaghetti O's and frozen Ellio's french bread pizzas. And Entenmann's pastries of course. Oh what a walk down memory lane. But I miss the days of bone broth soups and homemade kimchi. Call me old fashioned, I miss my Moms cooking (& the Entenmann's 😂). What trend or homemade food memory do you remember?

Simple recipes like this became a way of life for me. Did you know that I wrote @Delish's Insanely Easy Weeknight Dinners for nearly 1 1/2 years? There are probably 350+ of my recipes on Delish.com and I still cook from them regularly.
🍴Or I love making new dishes like this Crispy Chicken & Quinoa Bake that are a riff of something else I already wrote. A classic one pot dinner. Chicken thighs are browned until the skin is really crispy and removed. Sautéed leeks and vegetables are softened, then mixed with chicken stock and topped with cooked quinoa and parsley. Add back the chicken and bake until it’s all warmed and crisp.
🍴You get the drift, satisfying and simple, but never basic. Link in profile to my recipe library on Delish. Let me know if you try any of the recipes. xoxo enjoy!

Last night we said goodbye to sweet Layla. She belongs to @scottkolb @faxmarks but I always loved her as if she were my own. This photo of us at Dog Beach in San Diego was one of the happiest of days. I'll remember it always along with the many trips we took together. She touched so many hearts and I feel privileged to have loved that little fruit loop. I hope she is running around in a beautiful field, barking at the local mailman & enjoying all the carbs that she loved so much. I'm going to miss you so much muffin. Wanted to share some of my favorite pics of this cutie. The sadness is slightly overwhelming, but we're coping the best we can. Luckily her photos will forever put a smile on our faces. xoxo

Sometimes there are signs that say slow down. My sign came in the form of a grade 2 muscle tear in the calf a week ago. A few days of false hope led me to be on my feet a bit too long and it's now forcing me to literally lie down with my feet up.
Yesterday was supposed to be a day to break in my new @traegergrills BBQ 😢, but instead luckily I got a good old fashioned hang out with my girl @maddymadmads.
I've been nonstop for months and almost not sure what my direction is. I now clearly see that slowing down and taking care of yourself is important. This injury is proving to be more painful than I could imagine but grateful that it's making me stop and think about things while I rest. I'd been feeling a bit overwhelmed and uninspired with work which has been keeping me from seeing friends because I felt unorganized and lacking in free time. I'm reviewing all my open projects and re-prioritizing, which feels 😳 but ☺️. Felt even less inspired about what I want to share and post here on Instagram. Lately it's felt less personal. Probably because I fell victim to the need to keep up 🙄. It used to be much more spontaneous, not so much anymore. (Ok, I do blame the lame algorithm for taking some of the fun out of it). So I guess I'll change things up, even if it results in a lack of likes or engagement. We've all gotta do what we love creatively 🎨📷🎞👩🏻‍🍳.
Meanwhile, quality time with Maddy included making a quick comforting Korean meal with a fast Skirt Steak Bulgogi, Cucumber Muchim (pickled with rice vinegar and sesame oil) with Kimchi and steamed rice. We made buttery @vermontcreamery @guittardchocolate chip cookies while watching the movie Spy (hilarious if you haven't seen it). I hadn't laughed that hard for a while. So, obviously not a typical Memorial Day weekend, but I am going to reward myself with a nap after this prolific post 😂. God bless if you read this entire caption, enjoy the rest of your holiday weekend. 🇺🇸

Cinnamon Cashew Cream. This simple recipe includes a little bit of my travels from this year. Sarah & Andrea at Villa @casadamarezanzibar helped us navigate the market place in Zanzibar and get the best prices. Emily at @trendsontrends curated an amazing tour of PDX with @visitportland to see their arsenal of local makers. Armand @armsfeelsgood of @_mamannyc_ & @chassagnette made me feel so welcome in Arles, his hometown. I’ve been wanting to write a recipe and take some photos just for me. Not for work, just to be creative and that’s what this recipe is all about. Hope you enjoy it. Tag someone whom you think might enjoy this or the story of the pieces that are behind it.

I'm celebrating the first step in rebranding my business with a new Instagram name later this week. It's been a wonderful time here @thejudylab, but I'm ready for the next chapter. Reflecting back, I realize I fell in love with cooking / documenting and in the process I created a career in food styling, I never imagined was possible.

This photo reminds me of Summer entertaining. I've been working hard on updating my home environment on the inside and out. Hoping that it will lead to more dinner parties and gatherings centered around food and drink.

I've gotten a bit handy these days, I bought a new sander and a bunch of other crazy equipment (Circular saw!), so let's see if I can do this right🤞!
